fr.liglab.adele.icasa.application

Interface Application

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Attributable, Identifiable

    public interface Application
extends Attributable, Identifiable
    Represents an installed application.
    Author:
    Thomas Leveque

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String APP_ID_BUNDLE_HEADER 
      static String APP_NAME_BUNDLE_HEADER
      This header is optional.
      static String APP_VERSION_BUNDLE_HEADER 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<org.osgi.framework.Bundle> getBundles()
      Returns all started bundles which are part of this application implementation.

      Returns the category of this application.

      Returns the human readable application name.

        static final String APP_ID_BUNDLE_HEADER
        See Also:

        This header is optional.

      • APP_VERSION_BUNDLE_HEADER

        static final String APP_VERSION_BUNDLE_HEADER
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the human readable application name. This name should not be more than 80 characters. This value must be set as an attribute value.
        Returns:
        the human readable application name.

      • getVendor

        String getVendor()
        Returns the vendor of this application. This value must be set as an attribute value.
        Returns:
        the vendor of this application.

      • getVersion

        String getVersion()
        Returns installed version of this application. This value must be set as an attribute value.
        Returns:
        installed version of this application.

      • getCategory

        ApplicationCategory getCategory()
        Returns the category of this application. It defines which kind of application is provided and will result on a computed criticity value. This value must be set as an attribute value.
        Returns:
        the category of this application.

      • start

        void start(ProgressMonitor monitor)
        Starts this application. Resources for this application must not be allocated before it has started.
        Parameters:
        monitor - a operation progress monitor (may be null)

      • stop

        void stop(ProgressMonitor monitor)
        Stops this application. Allocated resources must be clean up before returning.
        Parameters:
        monitor - a operation progress monitor (may be null)

      • resume

        void resume(ProgressMonitor monitor)
        Resume this application if it has been paused.
        Parameters:
        monitor - a operation progress monitor (may be null)

      • pause

        void pause(ProgressMonitor monitor)
        Stop application computation temporary. All computation must be stopped or paused. In particular, there should not be any messages sent from this digital application. However, incoming messages may still arrive. Allocated resource could remain in memory.
        Parameters:
        monitor - a operation progress monitor (may be null)

      • getBundles

        Set<org.osgi.framework.Bundle> getBundles()
        Returns all started bundles which are part of this application implementation. The application bundles may be installed but not started, in this case, returns an empty set.
        Returns:
        all bundles which are part of this application implementation.

      • getState

        ApplicationState getState()
        Returns application activation state.
        Returns:
        application activation state.
